content.question: A block is pressed against a horizontal spring, compressing the spring, as shown at the top of the figure. The block is then moved, compressing the spring a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>, which changes the potential energy in the spring by an amount <math alttext="delta U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The spring is then compressed an additional distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>, which then changes the potential energy in the spring by an amount <math alttext="delta U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following, if any, correctly compares <math alttext="delta U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="delta U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta U sub 2 is less than delta U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="delta U sub 2 equals delta U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="delta U sub 2 is greater than delta U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
The changes in potential energy cannot be determined without knowing the original compression.

content.answer: <math alttext="delta U sub 2 is greater than delta U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
